page.title: 05SOCIAL SURVEY
page.content: OF THE PEOPLE SURVEYED ON RELIGIOUS PRACTICE, IT WAS FOUND THAT{60% PROFESSED TO BELONG TO THE{CHURCH OF {ENGLAND. ROMAN CATHOLISISM}WAS PRACTICED BY{20%, METHODISM}BY{12.5%. {ONE PERSON}IN THE SURVEY WAS A{QUAKER. THE{OTHERS CLAIMED NO RELIGIOUS {AFFINITY. 66%}OF THE SURVEY GROUP CONSIDERED THEMSELVES TO BE{REGULAR {ATTENDERS}AT THE LOCAL PLACES OF WORSHIP. THE{C.OF E. CHURCH}IS SITUATED IN{STOKE CLIMSLAND,}THE {RECTOR, TERENCE JAMES FULLER,}IS ALSO {THE RURAL DEAN. THE METHODIST CHAPELS AT{DOWNGATE AND LUCKETT}ARE IN THE {CALLLINGTON AND GUNNISLAKE CURCUIT. THE{MINISTER}AT{DOWNGATE}IS{JOHN {HATTERSLEY,}WHILE {JOHN WREN}HAS PASORAL CARE OF{LUCKETT.}THE{CATHOLIC {CHURCH}IS IN{CALLINGTON}AND THE{PRIEST IS FATHER MICHAEL CRAIG-McFEELY.
